snippet: Construction of the 96-story condominium building, arguably New York City’s tallest, was briefly halted after the piece fell from a hoist.
abstract: Section of guardrail dislodges from hoist at top of construction site at 432 Park Avenue in Manhattan, falling 81 stories to ground; incident results in stop-work order at building, arguably New York City's tallest; no one is injured in accident.
lead_paragraph: Construction of the 96-story condominium building, arguably New York City’s tallest, was briefly halted after the piece fell from a hoist.

headline.main: Guardrail Falls 81 Stories at Park Avenue Tower Work Site
headline.print_headline: Railing Piece Falls 81 Stories at Construction Site
